p: Our analysis excludes Hawaii, Alaska, and Oklahoma because of the unique legal circumstances in each state. Tribes in Hawaii do not have federal recognition. While tribal governments in Alaska have much in common with tribal governments in the rest of the U.S., the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act created important, distinct features of Alaska Native governments. The unique history of Oklahoma has produced a unique landscape of tribal land status. As a result, we were unable to identify whether turbines in Oklahoma were on or off tribal lands [23].
